description: This vegan tofu bulgogi is prepared with a traditional Korean marinade and then baked. The dish is gluten-free if tamari is used. Serve with rice and vegetables or accompaniments of choice. Instructions are for the freeze-and-marinate method described in the blog post. See notes section for a crispier version like what's pictured.
name: Vegan Tofu Bulgogi
recipeIngredient: 1 package extra-firm tofu (12 to 16 oz; used water-packed, not vacuum-packed)
1 green onion (both green and white parts, chopped)
2 and 1/2 tbsp coconut sugar (or brown sugar)
1 tbsp gochujang, sriracha, or chili garlic paste

recipeInstructions.text: Place the drained tofu in the freezer overnight. Remove from the freezer and thaw, either at room temperature on the counter, or in the microwave for a faster option.
Press the tofu using towels, paper towels, or a tofu press, for at least 20 minutes. Slice the tofu into about 12 pieces.
